Covid Australia daily stats update - charts on cases, deaths and contact tracing for 16 August

From 16 August 2021:


Monday was Australiaâ€™s deadliest Covid day in almost a year, with seven deaths recorded, all in New South Wales.


NSW reported 478 new Covid cases, which is another record number since the pandemic began. Contact tracers continue to be under pressure, as the origin of 70.5% of these cases is still under investigation.


Cases continue to trend up Victoria, with 22 reported. This eclipses the previous peak from last month. The source of 22.7% of these cases is under investigation and there are five people in hospital.
